data.title: St. Louis CITY SC Come from Behind to Secure a Point Against Sporting KC
data.meta_description: St. Louis CITY SC come from behind twice to secure a point in a 3-3 goal fest against their rivals Sporting KC. Alan Pulido gave the hosts the lead, before Klauss and Célio Pompeu gave CITY SC the lead heading into halftime. Goals from Dániel Sallói and Erik Thommy recaptured
data.text:
St. Louis CITY SC come from behind twice to secure a point in a 3-3 goal fest against their rivals Sporting KC. Alan Pulido gave the hosts the lead, before Klauss and CÃ©lio Pompeu gave CITY SC the lead heading into halftime. Goals from DÃ¡niel SallÃ³i and Erik Thommy recaptured the lead for Sporting KC, but Tomas Totlandâs last-minute strike earned CITY SC a well-earned draw on the road. The draw was CITY SCâs first point at Sporting KCâs Childrenâs Mercy Park.

Postgame Notes

Klauss recorded his second consecutive goal, giving him three goals this season

Klauss picked up his first assist of the season

The match marked the second time Klauss has recorded a goal and an assist in the same match for CITY SC (the other match was on March 25, 2023, 4-0 W vs Real Salt Lake)

Rasmus Alm picked up his second assist of the season

CITY SC is 14-7-7 all-time with Alm on the field and are 8-3-3 when he starts

For the second consecutive week Alm provided the assist for Klaussâ goal

Chris Durkin picked up his first assist for CITY SC

CÃ©lio Pompeu scored his third goal of the season

Tomas Totland recorded his first goal for CITY SC

The goal marked Totlandâs third goal contribution of the season (1 goal, 2 assists)

Pompeu has now scored in his last two matches at Childrenâs Mercy Park after tallying the lone goal for CITY SC in the away leg of the 2023 MLS Playoffs

CITY SC are now 2-1-1 all-time against Sporting KC in the regular season

The draw marked the first point for CITY SC at Childrenâs Mercy Park

St. Louis have earned at least a point from a losing position in five of their nine MLS matches this season (1-1 vs Real Salt Lake, 2-2 vs Austin FC, 3-3 vs LA Galaxy, 2-2 vs D.C. United and 3-3 vs Sporting KC)

CITY SC outshot Sporting KC 20-7 on the night. Over the last two matches St. Louis has outshot their opponents by 31-9.
